description: From Middle English upreren, equivalent to up- +‎ rear.

verbs.description: uprear (third-person singular simple present uprears, present participle uprearing, simple past and past participle upreared) (transitive, intransitive)

entries.meaning: To raise something up; to rise up; to erect
examples: With tears, with blushes, sighs and clasped hands, / With innocent upreared arms to heaven,  […]
